calloutBox.title: Responsible Raccoons
calloutBox.subTitle: 60 months to 68 months
calloutBox.content: Our Responsible Raccoons program has 20 children ranging from approximately 60 months to approximately 68 months old.  We have two consistent and nurturing teachers caring for our preschool children daily.

mainContent.title: Program Details
mainContent.content: As their final class before their continued education to Kindergarten, each child is given the opportunity to learn in a preschool rich environment. This experience consists of a morning circle time with calendar and our weekly theme, learning area activities centered around art, more challenging math and science skills, with an emphasis on lowercase letters through Zoophonics and Handwriting Without Tears. Midway through the year after a full letter review, the class will begin working with word families to begin their easy reading skills. Throughout the year, we continue to improve self-help skills in our preparation for Kindergarten Readiness. Our Raccoons classroom is taking one nap a day, playing outdoors twice a day, and enjoying our nutritional menu.
list: Personal cot and storage area provided
Parents provide an extra set of clothes and a cot sheet
Weekly Bible stories and prayers before each meal
Nutritious breakfast, lunch and, snack provided

boxes.title: Ms. Stacy - Lead Teacher
boxes.text: I have been a part of Big Steps since August of 2011. I have my Associates Degree in Early Childhood Development and I have been working with children for 25+ years. My daughter Kayleigh attends Aquinas College and also works at Big Steps. I enjoy time with my daughter and our dog Moose, the Summer sun, collecting frogs, and watching shows.

boxes.title: Ms. Kim M
boxes.text: I went to Ball State University in Indiana to study Zoology, and then moved back to Michigan. I started working at Big Steps in September 2014 and working here has changed my mind about my career path. In my free time, I enjoy camping with family, going to concerts, and wire wrapping.

boxes.title: Ms. Bri
boxes.text: I graduated from Lowell High School in 2017 and I am furthering my education to become a Preschool Teacher at Grand Rapids Community College. In my free time, I love to color and enjoy helping children learn in the classroom. Working at Big Steps has been a joy and is the perfect fit for me. My future goal is to become a Lead Teacher in a classroom, once my education is completed.
